channel.title: An award for lisp?
channel.description: LMAO that is one of the most ridiculous things I have ever seen. Why dont we make awards for every programming language while we are at it.

item.title: An award for lisp?
item.dc:creator: @atrox atrox_
item.description:
@atrox wrote:

javedman0208:

The awards are a good idea, but for the people who have awards for more than 3 programming languges they should get like an overal award which is Just Programming, such as “Programming guru”.

'cause that has never ever been suggested before…

Read full topic

item.title: An award for lisp?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:49, topic:310495”]Quoted so that it’s here forever:

HAI void DANCE(&doublebubble HATS, &doublebubble SUNGLASSES); INT OMGmain() { ... } void DANCE(&HATS,&SUNGLASSES) { ... }

I herd predefining functions waz gai.

[quote author=BAsh link=topic=406927.msg3011140#msg3011140 date=1256775974]

Call it werid, but I like to keep my main method/function at or near the very top.

Use java. You can reorder methods any way you want.
[/quote][/quote]
ur cool

Read full topic

item.title: An award for lisp?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Zeldas*, post:42, topic:310495”]I wants a LOLCATS award

[code]HAI
#I CAN HAZ STUDIO.omg

void DANCE(&doublebubble HATS, &doublebubble SUNGLASSES);

INT OMGmain()
{
JEEZUS = OmgwtfNewObject;
doublebubble HATS;
doublebubble SUNGLASSES;
DANCE(&HATS,&SUNGLASSES)
JEEZUS.DANCE(OMGWTFBBQ.mambo5);
LOLCAT SAY << “JEEZUS CAN HAZ MAMBO no. 5 WIT SUNGLASSES” << “\OMFGNEWLINE”;
RETURN www.lolcats.com;
KKTHNKZBYE
}

void DANCE(&HATS,&SUNGLASSES)
{
LAWL!!! DNCE PRTY!.WtfLemonade;
DrawObject.DANCING(NoHATS!, BUT SNGLSSES R KAY!); //returns 0 for hats, 1 for sunglasses
}

[/code][/quote]

mopcat fink you need to lurn lolcode

Read full topic

item.description:
@Zeldas wrote:

[code]HAI

void DANCE(&doublebubble HATS, &doublebubble SUNGLASSES);

INT OMGmain()
{
JEEZUS = OmgwtfNewObject;
doublebubble HATS;
doublebubble SUNGLASSES;
DANCE(&HATS,&SUNGLASSES)
JEEZUS.DANCE(OMGWTFBBQ.mambo5);
LOLCAT SAY << “JEEZUS CAN HAZ MAMBO no. 5 WIT SUNGLASSES” << “\OMFGNEWLINE”;
RETURN www.lolcats.com;
KKTHNKZBYE
}

void DANCE(&HATS,&SUNGLASSES)
{
LAWL!!! DNCE PRTY!.WtfLemonade;
DrawObject.DANCING(NoHATS!, BUT SNGLSSES R KAY!); //returns 0 for hats, 1 for sunglasses
}

[/code]

item.title: An award for lisp?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:36, topic:310495”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=406927.msg3009694#msg3009694 date=1256679445]
VBS is even less of a language than VB, so diaf.
[/quote]
Can you explain to me how? I used to use VB, but I use java now. I was going to try VBS but your saying its less of a language. I’m not arguing that it’s less of a language, I’m just asking how it is.[/quote]
It was basically Microsoft’s failed attempt at replacing JavaScript, and got recycled into a batch semi-replacement. Why would you ever use VBS when you could use Powershell, or even better, Bash.

Read full topic
